The Act is titled the "Griffith Project Prepayment and Conveyance Act" and includes definitions for various terms. The Act, titled the "Griffith Project Prepayment and Conveyance Act," defines the term "Authority" as the Southern Nevada Water Authority and the term "Griffith Project" as the Robert B. Griffith Water Project authorized by the Southern Nevada Water Project Act. Public Law 89-292, as amended, defines key terms such as "Secretary" as the Secretary of the Interior, "Acquired Land(s)" as all interests in land acquired by the United States for the Griffith Project, "Public Land" as lands under Federal ownership managed by the Bureau of Land Management, and "Withdrawn Land" as Federal lands reserved for a specific public purpose under the jurisdiction of the Bureau of Reclamation. The Public Law 89-292 defines key terms related to land acquisition for the Griffith Project, including "Secretary" as the Secretary of the Interior, "Acquired Land(s)" as all interests in land acquired by the United States, "Public Land" as lands managed by the Bureau of Land Management, and "Withdrawn Land" as Federal lands reserved for a specific public purpose under the jurisdiction of the Bureau of Reclamation or the National Park Service. SEC. 3. CONVEYANCE OF GRIFFITH PROJECT. The Authority will assume liability for the Griffith Project and pay the Federal repayment amount. The Secretary will convey all rights, title, and interest in project improvements, facilities, and acquired lands to the Authority. The Authority will assume liability for the Griffith Project and pay the Federal repayment amount. The Secretary will convey all rights, title, and interest in project improvements, facilities, and acquired lands to the Authority. Additionally, the Authority shall have a right-of-way across Public Land and Withdrawn Land for the operation and maintenance of the Griffith Project without payment of rental or fees. The Secretary and the Authority will agree on the land description for the rights-of-way established. The Secretary will provide a document memorializing the rights-of-way. If the conveyance does not occur within twelve months, a report will be submitted to Congress on the status. The Secretary and the Authority may modify existing contracts and land permits to conform to the provisions of this Act. This Act also clarifies the relationship between existing laws and future benefits. Upon conveyance of the Griffith Project, it shall no longer receive Reclamation benefits and will cease to be a Federal Reclamation Project. Federal ownership and interests in Lake Mead National Recreation Area will not be affected by this Act. Upon conveyance of the Griffith Project, Federal ownership and interests in Lake Mead National Recreation Area will remain unaffected. The National Park Service will continue to manage the area in accordance with existing legislation. The United States will not be liable for any damages related to the conveyed property after the transfer.
